bibl.title: Letter from A.V. McClain to Philip Showalter Hench, March 14, 1941

div1.p: McClain returns photographs to Hench, which had been believed lost.

div1.head: Letter from A.V. McClain to Philip Showalter Hench, March 14, 1941
div1.opener:
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
March 14, 1941
ASSISTANT TO THE PRESIDENT
answer 3/19
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Mr. Brewer, who until recently was
Alumni Secretary, has been made Dean of Freshmen
and has moved into another office. In going
over some papers, etc., pertaining to his work,
we ran across a package of pictures which I am
sending you under separate cover.

I do not remember the details, but I
heard something last fall about the loss of
these pictures. I am sending them back to you
without saying anything to him or President
Hutchison. My recollection is that these pic-
tures were considered lost and, therefore, I am
very glad to be able to turn them over to you.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, A. V. McClain Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
